text: If 5, 8, 6 and 2 occur with frequencies 3, 2, 4 and 1 respectively. Find the product of the modal and the median number
explanation:
Arrange in ascending order2, 5, 5, 5, 6, 6, 6, 6, 8, 8Position of median = N/2 = 10/2 = 5th and 6th∴Median = (6+6) / 2 = 12/2 = 6Mode the item that repeats itself most = 6∴Product of modal and median number = 6 x 6 = 36
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The table above shows the number of pupils in each age group in a class. What is the probability that a pupil chosen at random is at least 11 years old?
explanation:
P(At least 11 yrs) = P(11yrs) + P(12yrs)= \(\frac{27}{40}\) + \(\frac{7}{40}\)= \(\frac{34}{40}\)= \(\frac{17}{20}\)

The table above gives the frequency distribution of marks obtained by a group of students in a test. If the total mark scored is 200, calculate the value of y

text: Find the value of x for which the function f(x) = 2x\(^3\) - x\(^2\) - 4x + 4 has a maximum value
explanation:
f(x) = 2x\(^3\) - x\(^2\) - 4x – 4f’(x) = 6x\(^2\) - 2x – 4As f’(x) = 0Implies 6x\(^2\) - 2x – 4 = 03x – x – 2 = 0 (By dividing by 2)(3x + 2)(x - 1) = 03x + 2 = 0 implies x = \(\frac{-2}{3}\)Or x - 1 = 0 implies x = 1f’(x) = 6x\(^2\) - 2x – 4f’’(x) = 12x – 2At max point f’’(x) < 0∴f’’(x) = 12x – 2 at x = 1= 12(1) – 2= 12 – 2 = 10∴ Max at x = \(\frac{-2}{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Make L the subjects of the formula if  d = \(\sqrt{\frac{42w}{5l}}\)

text: The nth term of the sequence \(\frac{3}{2}\), 3, 7, 16, 35, 74 ..... is
Find the sum to infinity of the series \(2+\frac{3}{2}+\frac{9}{8}+\frac{27}{32}+......\)
explanation:
a = 2r = \(\frac{3}{4}\)S = \(\frac{a}{1-r}\)S = \(\frac{2}{1-\frac{3}{4}}\)= \(\frac{2}{\frac{1}{4}}\)S = \(\frac{2}{1}\times \frac{4}{1}\)= 8.

text: Find y, if \(\sqrt{12}-\sqrt{147}+y\sqrt{3} = 0\)
explanation:
\(\sqrt{12}\) -\(\sqrt{147}\) + y\(\sqrt{3}\) = 0\(\sqrt{4\times 3}\) - \(\sqrt{49\times 3}\) + y\(\sqrt{3}\) = 02\(\sqrt{3}\) - 7\(\sqrt{3}\) + y\(\sqrt{3}\) = 0y\(\sqrt{3}\) = 7\(\sqrt{3}\) - 2\(\sqrt{3}\)y = \(\frac{5\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}}\)y = 5

text: The volume of a hemispherical bowl is \(718\frac{2}{3}\). Find its radius .
explanation:
Volume of bowl \(\frac{2}{3}\pi r^3\\718\frac{2}{3}=\frac{2}{3}\pi r^3\\\frac{2156}{3}=\frac{2}{3} \times \frac{22}{7} \times r^3∴r^3 = \frac{2156 \times 3 \times 7}{3 \times 2 \times 22}\\r^3 = 343\\r = \sqrt[3]{343}\\r= 7.0cm\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A particle P moves between points S and T such that angles SPT is always constant of ST constant. Find the locus of P

options.A: It is a semi circle with ST as diameter
options.B: It is a perpendicular bisector of St
options.C: It is a quadrant of a circle with ST as diameter
options.D: It is a straight line perpendicular to ST

explanation:
When a particle P moves such that the angle ∠SPT is constant while ST remains fixed, it traces a circular path. Specifically, the locus of P is a semicircle because points on the circle subtended by the line segment ST maintain that angle.

text: A man 40 m from the foot of a tower observes the angle of elevation of the tower to be 30º. Determine the height of the tower.
explanation:
Tan 30 = \(\frac{h}{40}\)\(\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}=\frac{h}{40}\)h\(\sqrt{3}\) = 40h = \(\frac{40}{\sqrt{3}}\)h = \(\frac{40}{\sqrt{3}} \times \frac{\sqrt{3}}{\sqrt{3}}\)h = \(\frac{40\sqrt{3}}{3}\)
